intro: Linosyris heterophylla, commonly known as the variable leaf linosyris, is a flowering plant native to the Mediterranean region. It is a member of the Polygonaceae family, which includes plants such as buckwheat and sorrel. The plant is characterized by its alternate, often variable in shape leaves, which can range from ovate to linear. It produces small, greenish flowers that are clustered in inflorescences, typically blooming in late spring to early summer. Linosyris heterophylla is adapted to rocky and dry habitats, showcasing its resilience to arid conditions.
